Description:
The FHIR Code Status sub-resource defines a concept around collected consent for a patient code status. A code status documents the level of medical interventions a patient consents to receiving if their heart or breathing stops. The Consent.Read interaction returns data about a specific code status for a patient.

This resource respects patient-level Break-the-Glass checks and advanced directive security checks as configured in Epic. Audit events are logged to the patient audit trail when a code status is accessed by this resource.

category.Name: category
category.Description: The type of code status. Hard-coded to SNOMED code 11291000146105.

comments.Name: extension
comments.Description: Comments entered for the code status.

context.Name: extension
context.Description: The context that the code status was recorded in. For example, “Outpatient, “Inpatient”, “HOV”, etc.

dateTime.Name: dateTime
dateTime.Description: Date and time that the code status was created.

identifier.Name: identifier
identifier.Description: ID of the order that recorded the code status.

patient.Name: patient
patient.Description: FHIR reference for the Patient the code status applies to.

performer.Name: performer
performer.Description: ID and name of the ordering provider.

policy.Name: policy
policy.Description: The policy of the code status.

scope.Name: scope
scope.Description: The scope of the code status.

status.Name: status
status.Description: The state of the code status for a patient. This value follows the specification of the FHIR ConsentState value set and will always be either ‘active’ or ‘inactive’.

verification.Name: verification
verification.Description: Shows whether this consent has been verified by the patient or their family.

verificationDate.Name: verificationDate
verificationDate.Description: The date that a patient verified their consent.

verified.Name: verified
verified.Description: Whether or not this consent has been verified. Returns true if either VerifiedWith or VerificationDate elements are answered.
